module.name: product_as_individual
module.keywords: module, product as individual, actual product

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of data that records the identification of an existing or potential future artefact - an actual product whose properties can only be known by observation or by derivation from observations.

It is likely, but not essential, that the artefact, was or will be made from a version of a product design, which will be represented by the ,
and
modules. The artefact will be represented by a
entity.

A revision made to the artefact is represented by a sub type of the entity
namely
or .
A revision of an actual product that has been made is represented by a entity.
A revision of a product that is planned to be made is represented a entity.
purpose.example: The front wheel on your car is an actual product - .
The computer with the serial number "PN X0467-71281" is an actual product - .
The plane, with tail number "GXY 8910", ordered by "Air 3000" that is just about to be manufactured is a predicted product - .

inscope.li: representation of the information to identify an actual product;
representation of the information to identify an actual product prior to its realization - a planned product.

outscope.li: representation of the information to identify a product design.

definition.def: an existing or potential future artefact - an actual or planned product whose properties can only be known by observation or by derivation from observations
an existing artefact - an actual product whose properties can only be known by observation or by derivation from observations
a potential future artefact - a product that is planned to be made for which propeties may be predicted

uof.name: Product_As_Individual
uof.description: The Product as individual UoF specifies the definitional information for the representation of data that records the identification of an existing or potential future artefact - an actual product whose properties can only be known by observation or by derivation from observations.

ae.refpath: product_as_individual product_as_individual <= product {product <- product_related_product_category.products[i] product_related_product_category <= product_category product_category.name='physically realized product'}
